docs.summary: Manage Workflows Phases and Cards

relatedGuides.name: Example: Sync a Lead Funnel with an External CRM

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to archive.

docs.summary:
Archives a card, removing it from the workflow.

Archived cards are still visible to site contributors in the
[workflow](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fworkflows).
To see archived cards, use
[List Cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/list-cards)
and set `fetchArcived` to `true`.

After a card is archived,
its attached contact can be attached to another card in an active phase.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to archive.

docs.summary:
Archives a card, removing it from the workflow.

Archived cards are still visible to site contributors in the
[workflow](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fworkflows).
To see archived cards, use
[List Cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/list-cards)
and set `fetchArcived` to `true`.

After a card is archived,
its attached contact can be attached to another card in an active phase.

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow to create the card in.

params.name: phaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to create the card in.

params.name: card
params.doc: Card details.

params.name: position
params.doc:
Card position, where the first card is `0`.

If a card already occupies the specified position,
that card and any subsequent cards are shifted to the right by 1.

Defaults to the last position.

docs.summary:
Creates a new card in the specified phase and workflow.

When creating a card, you provide a `name` and an optional `position`.

Cards are displayed according to their position from top to bottom,
starting from `0` and incrementing by 1.
If you create or move a card to an existing position,
the card in that position and any subsequent cards
are shifted down by 1.

If `position` is not specified,
the new card is given the bottom position.

examples.title: Create a card

params.name: phaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to create the card in.

params.name: card
params.doc: Card details.

params.name: position
params.doc:
Card position, where the first card is `0`.

If a card already occupies the specified position,
that card and any subsequent cards are shifted to the right by 1.

Defaults to the last position.

docs.summary:
Creates a new card in the specified phase and workflow.

When creating a card, you provide a `name` and an optional `position`.

Cards are displayed according to their position from top to bottom,
starting from `0` and incrementing by 1.
If you create or move a card to an existing position,
the card in that position and any subsequent cards
are shifted down by 1.

If `position` is not specified,
the new card is given the bottom position.

examples.title: Create a card

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow to create the phase in.

params.name: phase
params.doc: Phase details.

params.name: position
params.doc:
Phase position, where the first phase is `0`.

If a phase already occupies the specified position,
that phase and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

Defaults to the last position,
which is displayed before the win phase.

docs.summary:
Creates a new phase in the specified workflow.

When creating a phase, you provide a `name` and an optional `position`.

Phases are displayed according to their position from left to right,
starting from `0` and incrementing by 1.
If you create or move a phase to an existing position,
the phase in that position and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

If `position` is not specified,
the new phase is given the rightmost position.

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow to create the phase in.

params.name: phase
params.doc: Phase details.

params.name: position
params.doc:
Phase position, where the first phase is `0`.

If a phase already occupies the specified position,
that phase and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

Defaults to the last position,
which is displayed before the win phase.

docs.summary:
Creates a new phase in the specified workflow.

When creating a phase, you provide a `name` and an optional `position`.

Phases are displayed according to their position from left to right,
starting from `0` and incrementing by 1.
If you create or move a phase to an existing position,
the phase in that position and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

If `position` is not specified,
the new phase is given the rightmost position.

params.name: workflow
params.doc: Workflow details.

docs.summary:
Creates a new workflow.

When creating a workflow, you provide a `name` and optional `description`,
and the new workflow's `id` is returned.
By default, the new workflow contains a `winPhase` named "Win".
No other phases or cards are created.

To continue building the workflow,
use the returned workflow `id` to
[create phases](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/phases/create-phase)
and [add cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/drafts/workflows/cards/create-card)
to the new phases.

A site can have up to 30 workflows.
When this limit is reached, calls to this endpoint result in a 403 error.

params.name: workflow
params.doc: Workflow details.

docs.summary:
Creates a new workflow.

When creating a workflow, you provide a `name` and optional `description`,
and the new workflow's `id` is returned.
By default, the new workflow contains a `winPhase` named "Win".
No other phases or cards are created.

To continue building the workflow,
use the returned workflow `id` to
[create phases](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/phases/create-phase)
and [add cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/drafts/workflows/cards/create-card)
to the new phases.

A site can have up to 30 workflows.
When this limit is reached, calls to this endpoint result in a 403 error.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to delete.

docs.summary:
Deletes a card from a workflow.

Deleted cards are removed from the workflow completely and can't be restored.
To keep the card available for site contributors, use
[Archive Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/archive-card)
instead.

After a card is deleted,
its attached contact can be attached to another card in an active phase.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to delete.

docs.summary:
Deletes a card from a workflow.

Deleted cards are removed from the workflow completely and can't be restored.
To keep the card available for site contributors, use
[Archive Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/archive-card)
instead.

After a card is deleted,
its attached contact can be attached to another card in an active phase.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to delete.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to retrieve.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a card.

If the specified card is archived, an empty object is returned.
You can restore the card with
[Restore Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/restore-card).

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to retrieve.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a card.

If the specified card is archived, an empty object is returned.
You can restore the card with
[Restore Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/restore-card).

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to retrieve.

docs.summary: Retrieves a phase and its cards.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to retrieve.

docs.summary: Retrieves a phase and its cards.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the workflow to retrieve.

params.name: cardsPerPhase
params.doc:
Maximum number of cards to return per phase.
To retrieve additional pages of cards, use
[List Cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/list-cards)
(in the Cards API).

Defaults to `10`.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a workflow by ID.

Use this endpoint to list all phases and the first cards for each phase.

The returned workflow object contains all the active phases and the win phase.
The active phases are available in the `phasesList.phases` array,
and the win phase is available at `winPhase`.
Each phase's ID is in the phase object at `info.id`.
The phase ID is needed when
[moving](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/move-card)
or [restoring](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/restore-card)
a card.

By default, the workflow is returned with up to 10 cards per phase.
You can change the number of cards returned
with the `cardsInitialPageSize` parameter.

examples.title: Get a workflow

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the workflow to retrieve.

params.name: cardsPerPhase
params.doc:
Maximum number of cards to return per phase.
To retrieve additional pages of cards, use
[List Cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/list-cards)
(in the Cards API).

Defaults to `10`.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a workflow by ID.

Use this endpoint to list all phases and the first cards for each phase.

The returned workflow object contains all the active phases and the win phase.
The active phases are available in the `phasesList.phases` array,
and the win phase is available at `winPhase`.
Each phase's ID is in the phase object at `info.id`.
The phase ID is needed when
[moving](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/move-card)
or [restoring](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/restore-card)
a card.

By default, the workflow is returned with up to 10 cards per phase.
You can change the number of cards returned
with the `cardsInitialPageSize` parameter.

examples.title: Get a workflow

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow whose phases will be listed.

params.name: offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

params.name: limit
params.doc: Number of items to return.

params.name: sort
params.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of active phases in the specified workflow.

By default, the returned phases are sorted by their display order.

The win phase is not an active phase
and is therefore not returned with this endpoint.
To get the win phase ID, use
[Get Workflow](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/workflows/get-workflow?branch=workflows).

examples.title: List phases in a workflow

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow whose phases will be listed.

params.name: offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

params.name: limit
params.doc: Number of items to return.

params.name: sort
params.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of active phases in the specified workflow.

By default, the returned phases are sorted by their display order.

The win phase is not an active phase
and is therefore not returned with this endpoint.
To get the win phase ID, use
[Get Workflow](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/workflows/get-workflow?branch=workflows).

examples.title: List phases in a workflow

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow whose cards will be listed.

params.name: fetchArchived
params.doc:
Filters for archived cards.
If set to `true`,
only archived cards are returned.
If set to `false`,
only cards that are not archived are returned.

Defaults to `false`.

params.name: offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

params.name: attachmentValue
params.doc: Filters for cards with the specified contact ID.

params.name: phaseId
params.doc: Filters for cards in the specified phase.

params.name: limit
params.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `50`.

params.name: sort
params.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`, `createdDate`, `updatedDate`, `phaseId`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of cards in the specified workflow.

By default, the returned cards are sorted by their display order.

List of fields to sort by.

examples.title: List all cards in a workflow

params.name: limit
params.doc:
Number of workflows to return.
 If omitted, all results are returned.

params.name: offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

params.name: sort
params.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`, `description`, `createdDate`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of the site's workflows.

By default,
the returned workflows are sorted by `name` in ascending order.
Sorting is applied lexicographically,
so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

examples.title: List 3 workflows

params.name: limit
params.doc:
Number of workflows to return.
 If omitted, all results are returned.

params.name: offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

params.name: sort
params.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`, `description`, `createdDate`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to move.

params.name: newPhaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to move the card to.

params.name: newPosition
params.doc: Position of the card in the phase, where the first card is `0`.

docs.summary:
Moves a card to another phase or a new position within the current phase.

To move a card, the new phase ID must be provided.
You can use
[Get Workflow](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/workflows/get-workflow)
to get IDs for all the phases in the workflow,
including the win phase.

If a card is moved to the win phase,
its attached contact can be attached to another card in an active phase.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to move.

params.name: newPhaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to move the card to.

params.name: newPosition
params.doc: Position of the card in the phase, where the first card is `0`.

docs.summary:
Moves a card to another phase or a new position within the current phase.

To move a card, the new phase ID must be provided.
You can use
[Get Workflow](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/workflows/get-workflow)
to get IDs for all the phases in the workflow,
including the win phase.

If a card is moved to the win phase,
its attached contact can be attached to another card in an active phase.

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow that contains the phase to move.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to move.

params.name: newPosition
params.doc:
New phase position, where the first phase is `0`.

If a phase already occupies the specified position,
that phase and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

docs.summary:
Moves a phase to a new position in its workflow.

Phases are displayed according to their position from left to right,
starting from `0` and incrementing by 1.
If you create or move a phase to an existing position,
the phase in that position and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow that contains the phase to move.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to move.

params.name: newPosition
params.doc:
New phase position, where the first phase is `0`.

If a phase already occupies the specified position,
that phase and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

docs.summary:
Moves a phase to a new position in its workflow.

Phases are displayed according to their position from left to right,
starting from `0` and incrementing by 1.
If you create or move a phase to an existing position,
the phase in that position and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to restore.

params.name: newPhaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to restore the card to.

params.name: newPosition
params.doc:
Position of the restored card in the phase,
 where the first card is `0`.

docs.summary:
Restores an archived card to the specified phase.

To restore a card, the new phase ID must be provided.
You can use
[Get Workflow](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/workflows/get-workflow)
to get IDs for all the phases in the workflow,
including the win phase.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to restore.

params.name: newPhaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to restore the card to.

params.name: newPosition
params.doc:
Position of the restored card in the phase,
 where the first card is `0`.

docs.summary:
Restores an archived card to the specified phase.

To restore a card, the new phase ID must be provided.
You can use
[Get Workflow](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/workflows/get-workflow)
to get IDs for all the phases in the workflow,
including the win phase.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to update.

params.name: cardInfo
params.doc: Card details.

docs.summary:
Updates a card's properties.

To reorder cards, use
[Move Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/move-card).
To archive or restore a card, use
[Archive Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/archive-card)
or [Restore Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/restore-card),
respectively.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to update.

params.name: cardInfo
params.doc: Card details.

docs.summary:
Updates a card's properties.

To reorder cards, use
[Move Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/move-card).
To archive or restore a card, use
[Archive Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/archive-card)
or [Restore Card](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/restore-card),
respectively.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to update.

params.name: phase
params.doc: Phase details to update.

docs.summary:
Updates a phase's name.

To reorder phases, use
[Move Phase](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/phases/move-phase).
To reorder or rename cards, use the
[Cards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards).

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to update.

params.name: phase
params.doc: Phase details to update.

docs.summary:
Updates a phase's name.

To reorder phases, use
[Move Phase](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/phases/move-phase).
To reorder or rename cards, use the
[Cards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards).

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the workflow to update.

params.name: workflow
params.doc: Workflow info.

docs.summary:
Updates a workflow's name or description.

To rename or reorder phases or cards, use the
[Phases API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/phases)
or the
[Cards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards),
respectively.

docs.summary: entity representing a card-info

members.name: id
members.doc: Card ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name shown at the top of the card.

members.name: description
members.doc: Card description.

members.name: primaryAttachment
members.doc: Details about the contact attached to the card.

members.name: dueDate
members.doc: Due date.

members.name: source
members.doc: Name of the app or service that created the contact.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `createdDate` instead.

members.name: updatedAt
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `updatedDate` instead.

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase that currently holds the card.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the card was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the card was updated.

members.name: info
members.doc: Card details.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items that were skipped in the current sort order.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that matched the filter.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of returned items.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:  
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow whose cards will be listed.

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: Filters for cards in the specified phase.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `50`.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

members.name: attachmentValue
members.doc: Filters for cards with the specified contact ID.

members.name: fetchArchived
members.doc:
Filters for archived cards.
If set to `true`,
only archived cards are returned.
If set to `false`,
only cards that are not archived are returned.

Defaults to `false`.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`, `createdDate`, `updatedDate`, `phaseId`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

members.name: cards
members.doc: List of cards.

members.name: pagination
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the card to retrieve.

members.name: card
members.doc: Requested card.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow to create the card in.

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase to create the card in.

members.name: card
members.doc: Card details.

members.name: position
members.doc:
Card position, where the first card is `0`.

If a card already occupies the specified position,
that card and any subsequent cards are shifted to the right by 1.

Defaults to the last position.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the newly created card.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the card to update.

members.name: cardInfo
members.doc: Card details.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the card to delete.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the card to move.

members.name: newPhaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase to move the card to.

members.name: newPosition
members.doc: Position of the card in the phase, where the first card is `0`.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the card to restore.

members.name: newPhaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase to restore the card to.

members.name: newPosition
members.doc:
Position of the restored card in the phase,
 where the first card is `0`.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the card to archive.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query, sort, and paging options.

members.name: cards
members.doc: List of cards that matched the query criteria.

members.name: pagination
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: id
members.doc: Phase ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name shown at the top of the phase.

members.name: info
members.doc: Phase information.

members.name: cardsList
members.doc: Cards contained in the phase.

docs.summary: a list of cards (a page) along with the total number

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of cards in the phase.

members.name: cards
members.doc:
List of cards in the phase.
 Sorted according to the card display order, from top to bottom.

members.name: id
members.doc: Workflow ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name for the workflow.

members.name: description
members.doc:
Workflow description,
 shown below the workflow's display name in the dashboard.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `createdDate` instead.

members.name: isDeletable
members.doc: Indicates whether the workflow can be deleted.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the workflow was created.

members.name: info
members.doc: Workflow information and metadata.

members.name: winPhase
members.doc:
Final phase of the workflow.
 Cards in `winPhase` are treated as if they are not part of the workflow.

 Normally, a contact can be attached to only 1 card in the workflow.
 Moving a contact's card to `winPhase`
 frees up the contact to be attached to another card in the workflow.

members.name: phasesList
members.doc: Phases that make up the workflow.

docs.summary: a list of phases (a page) along with the total number

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of phases in the workflow, excluding `winPhase`.

members.name: phases
members.doc:
List of phases in the workflow.
 Sorted according to the phase display order, from left to right.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow whose phases will be listed.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to return.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

members.name: phases
members.doc: List of phases.

members.name: pagination
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the phase to retrieve.

members.name: phase
members.doc: Requested phase.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow to create the phase in.

members.name: phase
members.doc: Phase details.

members.name: position
members.doc:
Phase position, where the first phase is `0`.

If a phase already occupies the specified position,
that phase and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

Defaults to the last position,
which is displayed before the win phase.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the newly created phase.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the phase to update.

members.name: phase
members.doc: Phase details to update.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the phase to delete.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow that contains the phase to move.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the phase to move.

members.name: newPosition
members.doc:
New phase position, where the first phase is `0`.

If a phase already occupies the specified position,
that phase and any subsequent phases
are shifted to the right by 1.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query, sort, and paging options.

members.name: phases
members.doc: List of phases that matched the query criteria.

members.name: pagination
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to return.
 If omitted, all results are returned.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: fields
members.doc:
List of projected fields to return.
 If omitted, all fields are returned.

 For a list of valid projected fields, see
 [Valid Workflow Projected Fields](#)

members.name: sort
members.doc:
List of fields to sort by.
 formatted as `"field:direction"`,
 where field is the field name
 and direction is `asc` or `desc`.

 Sorting is applied to the first item in the list,
 then the second, and so on.

members.name: workflows
members.doc: List of templates.

members.name: pagination
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: id
members.doc: Template ID.

members.name: workflow
members.doc: The requested template.

members.name: id
members.doc: a unique identifier of the template to clone

members.name: id
members.doc: the id of the newly created workflow

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of workflows to return.
 If omitted, all results are returned.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Supported fields:
`id`, `name`, `description`, `createdDate`

List of fields to sort by.
Formatted as `field:direction`,
where field is the field name
and direction is `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

Sorting is applied lexicographically, so `"abc"` comes after `"XYZ"`.

members.name: workflows
members.doc: Retrieved list of workflows.

members.name: pagination
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the workflow to retrieve.

members.name: cardsPerPhase
members.doc:
Maximum number of cards to return per phase.
To retrieve additional pages of cards, use
[List Cards](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/workflows/workflows/cards/list-cards)
(in the Cards API).

Defaults to `10`.

docs.summary:
describes the supported types of attachments (currently only supports Contact which is the default type) Possible values are:
  • ContactType

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC
